page.title: 05Thornhill Station.
page.content: One of the main points of Thornhill is the station which was built about 1790 and closed down in 1962.While the men were on duty they made gas for lamps and kept a look out for passing trains.About 10 trains stopped at the station and 20 passed through in a normal day.There hasn't been any accidents at the station but a train driver died whilst driving a train. Their uniform is a navy blue suit with a matching long sleeved waistcoat. The Duke of Buccleuch opened the station. In the snow, dark etc,they all wear orange, reflective jackets. The men have to get up very early, about 6.00am and work until 2.00pm. They might get called out because there are sheep on the line. On a single line the trains travel about 15mph on a double line 30mph.
